snippet: The government said prices for milk powder made outside China were up 30 percent since 2008, when several babies died after drinking Chinese-made formula.
abstract: Chinese government is investigating possible price fixing by foreign companies that produce infant milk powder for Chinese consumers; says prices for milk powder made outside China were up 30 percent since 2008, when several babies died after drinking Chinese-made formula.

byline.contributor: David Barboza contributed reporting from Shanghai, and Shi Da contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The government said prices for milk powder made outside China were up 30 percent since 2008, when several babies died after drinking Chinese-made formula.

headline.main: China Says Foreign Makers of Baby Formula May Be Fixing Prices
headline.print_headline: China Says Foreign Makers of Baby Formula May Be Fixing Prices
